It's better to run it on cloud services like Amazon EC2. You can run it on ubuntu with Wine.

But if you insist on running it with windows on your home machine...

1. Download the server. http://kerbalspaceprogram.com/kmp-server/

2. unzip it into a folder.

3. Copy these three files from from KSP install: Assembly-CSharp.dll, Assembly-CSharp-firstpass.dll, and UnityEngine.dll. I think they are in KSPData somewhere

3. Run the executable. (KMPServer.exe)

4. Open the port that the server is listening on in windows firewall. 2076 by default. (I can't help you with this, F*** windows firewall)

5. On your home router, forward that port to the computer you are running the server on, by name if possible

6. If you can't forward the port to the name of your computer, you must forward it to an ip address and configure your computer to use that ip address all the time instead of DHCP.

Alternatively, I'll set the whole thing up for you and maintain it on EC2 (for three months) for a total cost of 0.25 BTC.
You probably would have been better off posting this in the KMP thread.
